dram-simplesdram.cpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* dram-simplesdram.cpp: Simple SDRAM memory model  
00002 
00003    This assumes a full 8GB of physical memory for the
00004    purposes of selecting which physical address bits to
00005    use for different indexing purposes (e.g., bank selection).
00006 
00007    User specifies:
00008 
00009    Banks - number of DRAM arrays per chip
00010    Ranks - number of chips (assume 1 rank per chip)
00011   
00012    We assume 4KB pages (num columns)
00013    We assume an external memory bus width equal to the FSB width
00014    Any remaining bits are used for row select.
00015 
00016    We assume the 33-bit physical address is decomposed as:
00017   
00018    32                                                 0
00019    +----------+---------+----------+---------+--------+
00020    | rank num | row num | bank num | col num | unused |
00021    +----------+---------+----------+---------+--------+
00022 
00023    Access is determined by:
00024 
00025    t_RAS = row access strobe (active to precharge delay)
00026    t_RCD = row command delay (active to read/write delay)
00027    t_CAS = column access strobe (read/write to data-out/in)
00028    t_WR  = write recovery time (write to precharge delay)
00029    t_RP  = row precharge latency (precharge to active min delay)
00030 
00031    We're not properly simulating data bus contention at this time
00032    (that requires much uglier callbacks, or much more sophisticated
00033     command sequencing/timing to ensure that conflicts don't happen) */
00034 /*
00035  * __COPYRIGHT__ GT
00036  */
00037 
00038 #define COMPONENT_NAME "simplesdram"
00039 
00040 #ifdef DRAM_PARSE_ARGS
00041 if(!strcasecmp(COMPONENT_NAME,type))
00042 {
00043   int ranks;
00044   int banks;
00045   double t_RAS; /* in ns */
00046   double t_RCD; /* in ns */
00047   double t_CAS; /* in ns */
00048   double t_WR;  /* in ns */
00049   double t_RP;  /* in ns */
00050   int refresh_period; /* in ms */
00051 
00052   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%*[^:]:%d:%d:%lf:%lf:%lf:%lf:%lf:%d",&ranks,&banks,&t_RAS,&t_RCD,&t_CAS,&t_WR,&t_RP,&refresh_period) != 8)
00053     fatal("bad dram options string %s (should be \"simplesdram:ranks:banks:t_RAS:t_RCD:t_CAS:t_WR:t_RP:refresh_period\")",opt_string);
00054   return new dram_simplesdram_t(ranks,banks,t_RAS,t_RCD,t_CAS,t_WR,t_RP,refresh_period);
00055 }
00056 #else
00057 
00058 
00059 class dram_simplesdram_t:public dram_t
00060 {
00061   protected:
00062   struct dram_simplesdram_bank_t
00063   {
00064     int current_row; /* row address, if any, currently held in row buffer */
00065     tick_t when_available; /* cycle when previous command completed */
00066     tick_t when_precharge_ready; /* cycle when precharge complete and activation can start */
00067   };
00068 
00069   counter_t row_buffer_hits;
00070 
00071   int num_ranks;
00072   int num_banks; /* per rank */
00073   int num_rows; /* per bank */
00074   int c_RAS; /* in CPU cycles - different from command line parms! */
00075   int c_RCD; /* in CPU cycles - different from command line parms! */
00076   int c_CAS; /* in CPU cycles - different from command line parms! */
00077   int c_WR;  /* in CPU cycles - different from command line parms! */
00078   int c_RP;  /* in CPU cycles - different from command line parms! */
00079 
00080   int c_refresh; /* timestep per *row* refresh (!= DRAM refresh time; see comments in the constructor) */
00081   int refresh_rank;
00082   int refresh_bank;
00083   int refresh_row;
00084   tick_t last_refresh;
00085 
00086   int rank_shift;
00087   int rank_mask;
00088   int bank_shift;
00089   int bank_mask;
00090   int row_shift;
00091   int row_mask;
00092 
00093   struct dram_simplesdram_bank_t ** array;  /* first index = rank, second = bank */
00094 
00095   /* assume single channel */
00096   tick_t when_command_bus_ready;
00097   tick_t when_data_bus_ready;
00098 
00099   /* METHOD IMPLEMENTATIONS */
00100 
00101   public:
00102   /* CREATE */
00103   dram_simplesdram_t(int arg_num_ranks,
00104                      int arg_num_banks,
00105                      double t_RAS,
00106                      double t_RCD,
00107                      double t_CAS,
00108                      double t_WR,
00109                      double t_RP,
00110                      int arg_refresh_period
00111                     ): refresh_rank(0), refresh_bank(0), refresh_row(0), last_refresh(0)
00112   {
00113     init();
00114 
00115     num_ranks = arg_num_ranks;
00116     num_banks = arg_num_banks;
00117 
00118     when_command_bus_ready = 0;
00119     when_data_bus_ready = 0;
00120 
00121     /* can't just multiply by cpu-speed - need to keep as an even
00122        multiple of FSB clock cycles */
00123     c_RAS = (int)ceil(t_RAS * uncore->fsb_speed/1000.0) * uncore->cpu_ratio;
00124     c_RCD = (int)ceil(t_RCD * uncore->fsb_speed/1000.0) * uncore->cpu_ratio;
00125     c_CAS = (int)ceil(t_CAS * uncore->fsb_speed/1000.0) * uncore->cpu_ratio;
00126     c_WR = (int)ceil(t_WR * uncore->fsb_speed/1000.0) * uncore->cpu_ratio;
00127     c_RP = (int)ceil(t_RP * uncore->fsb_speed/1000.0) * uncore->cpu_ratio;
00128 
00129     array = (struct dram_simplesdram_bank_t**) calloc(num_ranks,sizeof(*array));
00130     if(!array)
00131       fatal("couldn't calloc dram ranks");
00132 
00133     for(int i=0;i<num_ranks;i++)
00134     {
00135       array[i] = (struct dram_simplesdram_bank_t*) calloc(num_banks,(sizeof(**array)));
00136       if(!array[i])
00137         fatal("couldn't calloc dram bank[%d]",i);
00138     }
00139 
00140     int offset_bits = log_base2(uncore->fsb_width);
00141     int col_bits = 12-offset_bits; /* 4KB page */
00142     int bank_bits = log_base2(num_banks);
00143     int rank_bits = log_base2(num_ranks);
00144     int row_bits = 33 - rank_bits - bank_bits - col_bits - offset_bits;
00145     num_rows = 1<<row_bits;
00146 
00147     bank_shift = 12;
00148     bank_mask = (1<<bank_bits)-1;
00149     row_shift = bank_shift + bank_bits;
00150     row_mask = (1<<row_bits)-1;
00151     rank_shift = row_shift + row_bits;
00152     rank_mask = (1<<rank_bits)-1;
00153 
00154     /* Typical DRAM refresh times are like 32ms or 64ms.  However, if there are
00155        ten total rows, then a refresh command needs to be issued every 3.2 or
00156        6.4 milliseconds.  So we set the refresh tick equal to the refresh-period
00157        divided the total number of rows across all ranks/banks. */
00158     double refresh_tick = arg_refresh_period/((double)num_ranks*num_banks*num_rows);
00159     /* convert ms to clock cycles */
00160     c_refresh = (int)floor(refresh_tick * 1000.0 * uncore->fsb_speed) * uncore->cpu_ratio;
00161 
00162     best_latency = INT_MAX;
00163   }
00164 
00165   /* DESTROY */
00166   ~dram_simplesdram_t()
00167   {
00168     for(int i=0;i<num_ranks;i++)
00169     {
00170       free(array[i]);
00171       array[i] = NULL;
00172     }
00173 
00174     free(array);
00175     array = NULL;
00176   }
00177 
00178   /* ACCESS */
00179   DRAM_ACCESS_HEADER
00180   {
00181     int chunks = (bsize + (uncore->fsb_width-1)) >> uncore->fsb_bits; /* burst length, rounded up */
00182 
00183     int rank = (baddr>>rank_shift)&rank_mask;
00184     int bank = (baddr>>bank_shift)&bank_mask;
00185     int row = (baddr>>row_shift)&row_mask;
00186 
00187     tick_t when_start = MAX(when_command_bus_ready,sim_cycle);
00188     tick_t when_done = TICK_T_MAX;
00189 
00190     dram_assert(chunks > 0,when_start+c_RP+c_RAS+c_CAS-(sim_cycle));
00191 
00192     /* TODO: This is not fully accurate: latency should only be
00193        for one chunk assuming critical word first, but the bus
00194        would continue to be occupied for the remainder of the latency. */
00195     int data_lat = (chunks >> uncore->fsb_DDR) * uncore->cpu_ratio;
00196     int lat = c_CAS + data_lat;
00197 
00198     if(array[rank][bank].current_row == row) /* row buffer hit */
00199     {
00200       when_done = MAX(when_start + lat,when_data_bus_ready + data_lat);
00201       array[rank][bank].when_available = when_done;
00202 
00203       row_buffer_hits++;
00204 
00205       /* TODO: c_WR shouldn't be paid for until row buffer written back to implement
00206          write combining in the row buffer... can lead to slower reads though. */
00207       if(cmd == CACHE_WRITE)
00208         array[rank][bank].when_precharge_ready = when_done + c_WR + c_RP;
00209 
00210     }
00211     else /* not in row buffer */
00212     {
00213       lat += c_RCD;
00214 
00215       /* can't activate page until precharged */
00216       when_start = MAX(when_start + c_RP,array[rank][bank].when_precharge_ready);
00217       when_done = MAX(when_start + lat,when_data_bus_ready) + data_lat;
00218 
00219       array[rank][bank].when_available = when_done;
00220       array[rank][bank].current_row = row;
00221 
00222       if(cmd == CACHE_READ || cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH)
00223         array[rank][bank].when_precharge_ready = when_start + c_RAS + c_RP;
00224       else if(cmd == CACHE_WRITE)
00225         array[rank][bank].when_precharge_ready = when_done + c_WR + c_RP;
00226     }
00227 
00228     lat = when_done - sim_cycle;
00229 
00230     when_data_bus_ready = when_done;
00231     when_command_bus_ready += uncore->cpu_ratio; /* +1 FSB cycle */
00232 
00233     total_accesses++;
00234     total_latency += lat;
00235     total_burst += chunks;
00236     if(lat < best_latency)
00237       best_latency = lat;
00238     if(lat > worst_latency)
00239       worst_latency = lat;
00240 
00241     return lat;
00242   }
00243 
00244   /* REFRESH */
00245   DRAM_REFRESH_HEADER
00246   {
00247     if(c_refresh <= 0)
00248       return;
00249     if((sim_cycle - last_refresh) >= c_refresh)
00250     {
00251       int rank = refresh_rank;
00252       int bank = refresh_bank;
00253       int row = refresh_row;
00254 
00255       /* increment counters for next row to refresh */
00256       refresh_rank = modinc(refresh_rank,num_ranks); //(refresh_rank+1) % num_ranks;
00257       if(refresh_rank == 0)
00258       {
00259         refresh_bank = modinc(refresh_bank,num_banks); //(refresh_bank+1) % num_banks;
00260         if(refresh_bank == 0)
00261           refresh_row = modinc(refresh_row,num_rows); //(refresh_row+1) % num_rows;
00262       }
00263 
00264       tick_t when_start = MAX(when_command_bus_ready,sim_cycle);
00265       tick_t when_done = TICK_T_MAX;
00266 
00267       if(array[rank][bank].current_row == row) /* row buffer hit */
00268       {
00269         array[rank][bank].when_available = sim_cycle + c_WR;
00270         array[rank][bank].when_precharge_ready = when_done + c_WR + c_RP;
00271       }
00272       else /* not in row buffer - need to read and then write back */
00273       {
00274         /* can't activate page until precharged */
00275         when_start = MAX(sim_cycle,array[rank][bank].when_precharge_ready);
00276         when_done = when_start + c_CAS + c_RCD;
00277 
00278         array[rank][bank].when_available = when_done;
00279         array[rank][bank].current_row = row;
00280 
00281         array[rank][bank].when_precharge_ready = when_done + c_WR + c_RP;
00282       }
00283 
00284       when_command_bus_ready += uncore->cpu_ratio; /* +1 FSB cycle */
00285 
00286       last_refresh = sim_cycle;
00287     }
00288   }
00289 
00290   /* STATS */
00291   DRAM_REG_STATS_HEADER
00292   {
00293     dram_t::reg_stats(sdb);
00294 
00295     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, "dram.row_buffer_hits", "total number of accesses that hit in row buffer", &row_buffer_hits, /* initial value */0, /* format */NULL);
00296     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, "dram.row_buffer_hit_rate","fraction of accesses that hit in row buffer",
00297         "dram.row_buffer_hits / dram.total_access",/* format */NULL);
00298   }
00299 
00300 };
00301 
00302 
00303 
00304 #endif /* DRAM_PARSE_ARGS */
00305 #undef COMPONENT_NAME
